Social Media Community Guidelines

Sientra envisions a world where everybody’s full beauty can be realized. As we pursue our vision, we recognize that, together, we are advancing what is possible in medical aesthetics and, in turn, opening up more ways to experience and reach many states of inner and outer beauty.

We encourage our social media community members to engage in discussions with us. Please feel free to ask questions, comment, share our posts, and discuss. When you do, we ask that you make sure your contributions are respectful, courteous, and constructive.

We accept that disagreements will happen. However, we will not tolerate when disagreements turn offensive. Please do not insult other community members or be disrespectful. When you disagree with something someone has said, please say so in a polite manner, and please provide sources for any information you cite, if you can.

To put it another way:

We will not tolerate threatening, abusive, harassing, intimidating, libelous, defamatory, obscene, vulgar, pornographic, profane, indecent, illegal or unlawful content. We will not tolerate spam, which we define as promotion of commercial interests or repeated posting of the same content.

Posts violating these requirements may be removed at any time and without notice. We also ask that you keep conversations on-topic with the original post. Our community members normally get along very well, and discussions can veer in a number of interesting directions. We ask that you help us keep focus by providing meaningful, relevant content to the members of our community.

This page is intended to answer questions and provide support for patients, physicians and the community. However, some questions really need the attention of medical experts. When questions get very technical, or when responding publicly may violate your privacy, we may send you a private message or direct you to a phone number to speak to a professional to address your concerns.

This page is monitored during business hours only, so please allow 24 hours for us to respond to your comments.

And, as always, in case of an emergency, dial 911.

Thank you for participating, and welcome!
